title: NASA to Announce Candidate Landing Regions for Artemis III Moon Mission
summary: NASA will hold a media teleconference at 2 p.m. EDT Friday, Aug. 19, to announce regions near the lunar South Pole the agency has identified as potential areas for astronauts to land as part of the Artemis III mission, targeted for 2025.

title: SLS arrives at the pad for Artemis 1 launch
summary: NASA’s Space Launch System made its third trip to the launch pad Aug. 17, this time with the intent of lifting by early next month.

title: Commercial geospatial technologies that detect GPS disruptions to be tested in military exercises
summary: U.S. military and allied forces in upcoming exercises will put to the test commercial technologies that could help detect GPS jamming or other activities that disrupt satellite-based navigation.

title: Russian spacewalk cut short by spacesuit power system problem
summary: Russian ground controllers ordered International Space Station commander Oleg Artemyev back to the airlock after data showed voltage fluctuations in his spacesuit Wednesday, cutting short a spacewalk to continue outfitting the European Space Agency’s robotic arm delivered to the complex last year.

title: NOAA, NASA, and Northrop Grumman complete major testing for JPSS-2 before launch
summary: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), NASA, and Northrop Grumman have completed the final major test of the Joint Polar Satellite System (JPSS)-2 spacecraft ahead of its delivery to Vandenberg Space Force Base, California, for launch.

title: Russian spacewalk to end early as suit power issue appears
summary: A Russian spacewalk is taking place at the ISS to continue preparations to fully activate the European Robotic Arm (ERA) and commission it for operational use.

title: Rocket Lab will self-fund a mission to search for life in the clouds of Venus
Seeking Regulatory Mercy: The case for extending constellation deployment deadlines
summary: Will regulators show mercy for constellation hopefuls battling unprecedented manufacturing and launch constraints outside their control?

title: SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket could still launch first military mission in 2022
summary: In a statement issued to Bloomberg, the US Space Force says that SpaceX’s Falcon Heavy rocket could still conduct its first operational...

title: AST SpaceMobile delays commercial satellite debut by six months
summary: Supply chain issues have pushed out the launch of AST SpaceMobile’s first operational satellite about six months to late 2023, the cellphone-compatible broadband constellation startup said Aug. 15.
